Body: I am looking into Google authentication (https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/android/)Is it possible to launch the same activity (via the Auth.GoogleSignInApi.getSignInIntent) from a browser as you do from a mobile app?If you use a browser to use google sign-in then you will automatically use the web application (see https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/). But I would like to use the mobile application when users are going to my website from a mobile browser on Android.I know it's possible to launch Intents from the Android browser but I'm unsure if it is also possible to launch the google sign-in intent AND have the reply returned to a webpage (a callback webpage if you will).So let's split this up in two parts:Is it possible to launch the google sign-in activity?Is it possible to get the reply from such an activity delivered to a web application?Kind regards,Roel
Title: How to launch com.google.android.gms.auth.GOOGLE_SIGN_IN from Android browser

history.Text: I am looking into Google authentication (https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/android/)Is it possible to launch the same activity (via the Auth.GoogleSignInApi.getSignInIntent) from a browser as you do from a mobile app?If you use a browser to use google sign-in then you will automatically use the web application (see https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/). But I would like to use the mobile application when users are going to my website from a mobile browser on Android.I know it's possible to launch Intents from the Android browser but I'm unsure if it is also possible to launch the google sign-in intent AND have the reply returned to a webpage (a callback webpage if you will).So let's split this up in two parts: - Is it possible to launch the google sign-in activity? - Is it possible to get the reply from such an activity delivered to a web application?Kind regards,Roel
How to launch com.google.android.gms.auth.GOOGLE_SIGN_IN from Android browser
